notes: A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men outsider her house in Caloocan (National Capital Region, Metro Manila) on April 1.
Unidentified assailants attacked two civilians at Batasan Hills in Quezon City (National Capital Region, Metro Manila) on 1 April. The victims were on a motorcycle. Both of them died.
An unidentified man was shot by an unidentified assailant along Commonwealth in Quezon City (National Capital Region, Metro Manila) on April 1. The unidentified man died.
A man was shot by an unidentified assailant while walking along the street in Caloocan (National Capital Region, Metro Manila) on April 1.
Two suspected drug personalities were killed during a police raid in in General Santos, South Cotabato on 2 April.
Soldiers of the 36th Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels at Barangay Bolhoon, San Miguel (Caraga, Surigao del Sur) on April 2. No casualties reported.
A drug suspect was shot dead and his partner wounded in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Cordova (Central Visayas, Cebu) on April 2.

2 unidentified armed gunmen on a motorcycle shot a town councilor within Guihulngan City (Negros Island, Negros Oriental) on April 2. The victim was on the NPA hit list, the NPA have denied responsibility for the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: 2 unidentified armed gunmen on a motorcycle shot a village chair and a village watchman in Carmen (Soccskargen, Cotabatol) on April 3. Police suspect that the attack is linked to his support for the government's war on drugs and his role in monitoring the activities of Isis-State inspired militants.
A drug suspect was wounded during a police raid in Cebu City, Cebu province on April 3.
Four unidentified assailants shot and killed public utility driver at Saavedra Street of Davao City (Davao Region), Davao del Sur on April 3. The driver was the only fatality.

assoc_actor_1: KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Labour Group (Philippines)
notes: Protestors led by the head of Coca Cola union, along with members of Kilusang Mayo Uno, were dispersed by the police in Davao (Davao Region, Davao del Sur) on 3 April. They were demonstrating in front of Coca Cola plant.

Around 50 protesters from various parts of the country traveled to Baguio (Cordillera Administrative Region, Benguet) on 3 April to urge the Supreme Court to dismiss a government-backed petition that would remove the chief justice from office.
Soldiers of the 36th Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels at Barangay San Roque, San Miguel (Caraga, Surigao del Sur) on April 3. No casualties reported.
2 unidentified armed gunmen shot village chief in Calinog town (Western Visayas, Iloilo) on April 3. No motive has been established.

The New People's Army ambushed two NPA surrenderees and their military convoy in Montevista (Davao Region, Davao de Oro) in the week of April 4. They had surrendered days before and supposedly had sensitive information about the NPA. Both surrenderees were killed.

New People's Army members ambushed an Indigenous People representative to the town council, and his two colleagues in Magpet (Soccskargen, Cotabato) on 4 April. He was a staunch critic of the NPA. The victim died, while his two colleagues were injured.
A police chief was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Isabela City (Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao, Basilan) on 4 April. No motive had been established.
Weapons Seizure: Soldiers recovered explosives, equipment, and documents from the NPA in Barnagay Tandik, Maragusan, Davao de Oro on 4 April.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed on a bus somewhere in San Juan (Ilocos Region, La Union) on April 4. Aside from being a suspected drug pusher, police are exploring the possibility that this act was a form of revenge. The victim was a suspect for the murder of an elderly lady.
A pastor, and his wife were shot by two motorcycle-riding assailants in Urdaneta (Ilocos Region, Pangasinan) on April 4. The pastor died, while his wife was injured.

The Army's 73rd Infantry Battalion engaged 15 NPA rebels under the Front 71 at the boundary of Barangays Tokawal and Alegria, Alabel, Sarangani on April 4. At least 72 families fled because of this attack. The NPA fled, leaving behind equipment used to create bombs. One soldier was injured.
The NPA blew up equipment and vehicles owned by a construction company at Barangay Palma Gil, Talaingod, Davao del Norte on 4 April. There were no casualties.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Angeles City, Pampanga province on 4 April.
Two drug suspects was shot dead shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in General Santos (Soccskargen, South Cotabato) on April 5.
Two drug suspects were killed during a shootout with the police at Laurel town, Batangas province on April 5. Two police officers died during the shootout.
A village captain was killed by unidentified armed men in Barangay Cambuga, Mulanay City, Quezon on 5 April.
A drug pusher was killed during a police raid at Talitay town, Maguindanao province on April 5. His wife was arrested.
Two suspected drug dealers were killed during an encounter with police at Norala tow, South Cotabato province on 5 April. Two police officers were wounded during the shootout.
A drug suspect was killed during an encounter with the police at Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur province on April 5. His companion escaped.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Members of the NPA killed a former member of the Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit at his house in Cawayan (Bicol Region, Masbate) on 6 April.

Defusal: The military defused an IED left by an unidentified armed group in Shariff Aguak (Autnomous Region in Muslim Mindanao, Maguindanao) on 6 April. The two suspects who planted the bomb were later arrested, their affiliation is still unclear.

Patrolling soldiers of the 43rd Infantry Battalion encountered NPA rebels at Barangay San Vicente in Catubig town, Northern Samar on April 6. Two NPA were arrested. Firearms, ammunition, and flash drives were recovered. There were no casualties.

Defusal: The military arrested two men that had planted a bomb in Shariff Aguak (Autnomous Region in Muslim Mindanao, Maguindanao) on 6 April. The two men attempted to escape after the military defused their bomb. They have been identified, but their group affiliation had yet to be ascertained.

Soldiers had an encounter with around 10 New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas at Barangay Kinam, Malapatan, Sarangani on April 7. 1 NPA surrendered. The military recovered a cache of equipment and bombs.
Drug surrenderees were killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Daraga, Albaya, Bicol Region on 8 April.

Prospective local candidates were attacked by unidentified gunmen along the road in Barangay Barubuhan, Suminot, Zamboanga del Sur on April 8. A municipal employee was killed, while 1 other companion was injured. Labad planned to run for village captain.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Suspected New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attempted to kill CAFGU member Wilson Geresola at Barangay Camalanda-an, Cauayan, Negros Occidental on 8 April. Gerensola was accompanied by a soldier. There were no casualties.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Tagbilaran City, Bohol on April 8. Two other suspected drug pushers were arrested.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Navotas, Metro Manila, National Capital Region on 9 April.

A high-value target drug suspect was abducted by unidentified armed men in Candelaria town, Quezon on 9 Apr 2018 as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List. The latter was involved in a shootout with police during a rescue operation in San Pablo City, Laguna on 10 Apr 2018, killing all 5 of them and 1 police as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List. 5 were also wounded, including the high-value target drug suspect as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.
Agreement: 34 guerrillas of the New People's Army surrendered to the Army's 19th Infantry Division in Magpet area, Cotabato on April 9. They turned over a number of firearms and explosives.
The military conducted air strikes on BIFF positions around Shariff Saydona Mustapha town area, Maguindanao on 9 April. No casualties or fatalities were noted.
Two armed drug gang had a shooutout in Mandaue City, Cebu, Central Visayas on April 9. One of the gangs supposedly had drug paraphernalia. One minor was killed and another 1 was injured.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Former Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Teachers (Philippines)
notes: On 9 Apr 2018, in Barangay Bulad, Isabela, Negros Occidental, three persons, including a former Army soldier and a former policeman, were killed by suspected NPA members. A 10-year old and a teacher were also wounded in the attack. Witnesses to the incident allege that two town officials are also responsible for the killings.
Soldiers had an encounter with a group of New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas in Barangay Gubat, Lagonoy, Camarines Sur on April 9. One NPA guerrilla was killed.
A drug suspect was killed during a shoot-out with police in Valenzuela City, Metro Manila on April 9. One police officer was wounded during the shootout.

Army soldiers killed a suspected New People's Army (NPA) guerrilla at Barangay Camalanda-an, Cauyan, Negros Occidental on April 9. Military suspected that the rebel and his companions were behind the assassination attempt on CAFGU member Wilson Gerenola. The fatality is also a drug surrenderer.

Police forces had an encounter with a group of kidnappers along the highway in San Pablo City, Laguna on 10 April. The kidnapping was supposedly related to drugs. 1 cop and 5 gang members died. 3 cops were injured.
Members of the Coalition for Justice staged a protest at the Supreme Court in Baguio, Benguet on 10 April, against 5 Supreme Court justices that they considered biased against Chief Justice Sereno.

Bayan Muna and other affiliated groups staged a protest in front of the city hall of Cebu City, Central Visayas on 10 April, against President Duterte's demand that Chief Justice Sereno is removed from office.

Soldiers of the 6th Infantry division captured a BIFF encampment in Shariff Saydona Mustapha area, Maguindanao on April 10. Around 6 rebels members were killed. Firearms and bombs were recovered from the campsite.

A high-value target drug suspect who was abducted by unidentified armed men in Candelaria town, Quezon on 9 Apr 2018, was involved in a shootout with police during a rescue operation in San Pablo City, Laguna on 10 Apr 2018, killing all 5 of them and 1 police as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List. 5 were also wounded, including the high-value target drug suspect as reported in the Philippine Daily Inquirer Kill List.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas ambushed a military truck transporting soldiers in Barangay Tagbac, Magpet, Cotabato on April 10. The military had detonated a roadside bomb. There were no casualties.
Unidentified armed men attacked soldiers of the 57th Infantry Battallion in Barangay Labo-Labo, Shariff Aguak on 10 April. There were no casualties.

Soldiers of the 6th Infantry division captured a BIFF encampment in Datu Salibo area, Maguindanao on April 10. Around 6 rebels members were killed. Firearms and bombs were recovered from the campsite.

Troops from the 9th Infantry Division under the 83rd Infantry Battalion had an encounter with a group of New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas in Barangay Payak, Bato, Camarines Sur on April 10. The military were responding to reports that the NPA were 'extorting' residents of Payak. 3 members of the NPA were killed, while 5 others were captured.

Troops of the 93rd Division Reconnaissance Company under the 9th Infantry Division had an encounter with a group of New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas in Barangay Pinamihagan, Lagonoy, Camarines Sur on April 11. The military recovered a landmine, firearms, and equipment from the battle site. No soldiers were injured, although a number of NPA guerrillas were supposedly injured.
Unidentified armed group set off an explosive that caused little damage at a housing project in Isabela City, Basilan on 11 April. No one was hurt.
BIFF set off a roadside bomb that exploded near a convoy of soldiers in Talayan area, Maguindanao on 11 April. There was 1 injury.

Soldiers of the 26th Infantry Battalion had an encounter with New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas at Barangay Del Monte, Veruela, Agusan del Sur on April 11. There were no casualties. The military recovered a huge cache of firearms.
Suspected BIFF had an encounter with soldiers of the 57th Infantry Battallion in Barangay Pagatin, Shariff Saydona Mustapha on 11 April. There were no casualties.

Unidentified gunmen attacked an intelligence officer and civilians in front of the Batangas City (Calabarzon) police station on April 12. Police suspect that the ambush was related to the intelligence officer's work on the drug trade. The intelligence officer and two civilians were injured.
Alleged members of the NPA assaulted a police headquarters located in Barangay San Mateo, Butuan City, Agusan del Norte province on 13 April, 2018. The assailants reportedly suffered casualties.
Property Destruction: Suspected New People's Army members burned a banana warehouse in Barangay Lunen, Tupi, South Cotabato on 13 April. Around P500-thousand worth of damages was caused by the fire.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: A drug suspect and village councilman was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed in Cebu City, Central Visayas, on 13 April. He was supposedly involved in illegal drugs.
Defusal: Government troops defused a bomb set by BIFF to blow up a bridge linking Maguindanao to Cotabato in Barangay Olandang, Midsayap on 14 April.
Weapons Seizure: Soldiers under the 91st Infantry Battalion recovered a weapons cached owned by the New People's Army in Barangay Ditike, San Luis, Aurora on 14 April.
The New People's Army had an encounter with soldiers at the remote village of Barangay Kalabugao, Impasugong, Bukidnon on 14 April. 1 pregnant NPA rebel was injured and taken by the military.
Detonation: Suspected BIFF planted an explosive that failed to set off at a bridge in Midsayap, Cotabato on 15 April.
Soldiers clashed with BIFF rebels at Barangay Nabundas, Sharrif Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao on 15 April. Two IEDs were recovered after the skirmish.
Soldiers clashed with BIFF rebels at Datu Salibo area, Maguindanao on 15 April. The military took over a BIFF firearms fabrication shop.

Weapons Seizure: Troops from the 4th Infantry Division seized a cache of dynamites, medical and food supplies at a jungle in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur on 15 April. The military believes that this cache was owned by the New People's Army.
Unidentified armed men attacked a village councilman in Pidigan, Abra, Cordillera Autonomous Region on 15 April. The councilman died, while his wife and sister were injured.
Suspected BIFF set off an improvised explosive device near the Army division first sentry along the highyway of Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao on 16 April. A civilian was injured.
Soldiers of the 40th Infantry Battallion clashed with 16 BIFF rebels in Barangay Nabundas, Shariff Saydona Mustapha on 16 April. Two BIFF were killed, while two were injured.
Suspected BIFF threw a grenade at civilians in Barangay Kolambog, Pikit, Cotabato on 15 April. Three civilians were injured.
The New People's Army ambushed three civilians in the town of Gigaquit, Surigao del Norte on 18 April. A Jehova's Witness pastor was killed. His two other companions were injured.
Suspected members of the New People's Army clashed with soldiers of the 39th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Upper Bala, Magsaysay, Davao del Sur on 18 April.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Suspected BIFF killed a CAFGU soldier in Barangay Bualan, Pikit, Cotabato on 18 April.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Santa Maria town, Bulacan province on 20 April.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Pandi town, Bulacan province on 20 April.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Malolos City, Bulacan province on 20 April.
Three drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Sto. Nino, San Juan del Monte City, Bulacan province, on 20 April.

assoc_actor_1: Kalikasan People's Network for the Environment
notes: Environmentalists, indigenous people, and farmer organized by Kalikasan held a demonstration at the Department of Justice headquarters in Manila, Metro Manila on April 20. They criticized the government for supposedly targeting environmental activists by branding the Communist Party of the Philippines and the New People's Army as 'terrorists.'
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Calumpit town, Bulacan province on 20 April.
Two suspected drug dealers were killed during a police raid at Baliuag town, Bulacan province on 20 April.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raide in General Santos, South Cotabato on 20 April. Firearms and drugs were supposedly recovered from their houses.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in General Santos, South Cotabato on 20 April. One of them had previously surrendered to the police.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Bocaue, Bulacan on 20 April.
A drug suspect was killed by police in Plaridel, Bulacan on 20 April.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Pulilan town, Bulacan province on 20 April.
Soldiers had an encounter with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Barangay Astorga, Sta. Cruz, Davao del Sur on 21 April. Two NPA were killed, one of whom was a minor.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid near the town center of Naawan, Misamis Oriental on the weekend of 21 April.

Former village chief Usan Asani and four relatives were killed by village chief Hermie Asao and his followers in Camamburingan, Ungkaya Pukanl, Basilan on 22 April. Asani was going to run against Asao in the upcoming elections.
Soldiers recovered without battle a New People's Army camp in Barangay Kilong-olao, Boliney, Abra on 21 April.
Soldiers recovered without battle a New People's Army camp in Dicamay Dos, Jones, Isabela on 21 April.

The private security army of a village chief had a shootout with police in Libona, Bukidnon on 21 April. The village chief and her companions were arrested. Firearms and explosives were confiscated. Three soldiers were wounded.
Nigerian drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Las Pinas, Metro Manila on 23 April. He had previously been charged for involvement in drugs.

Soldiers of the 27th Infantry Battalion had an encounter with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Barangay Amsipit, Maasim, Sarangani on 23 April. An alleged NPA commander was captured. Weapons and equipment were recovered.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Nueva Ecij province, Centra Luzon on 23 April.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Malhacan, Meycauayan, Bulacan on 23 April.

assoc_actor_1: CPA: Cordillera Peoples Alliance; Bayan Muna
notes: The Cordillera Peoples Alliance, along with indigenous people and members of Bayan Muna protested in front of the Supreme Court in Baguio City, Benguet on 23 April, to call for the dismissal of the petitions against the Supreme Court Chief Justice.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Talavera, Nueva Ecija on 23 April.
Soldiers of the 73rd Infantry Battalion had an encounter with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Barangay Upper Suyan, Malapatan, Sarangani on 24 April. Two NPA rebels were captured.
Police officer was killed by unidentified gunmen in Cebu City on 24 April. Police are exploring that the killing was related to drugs.
Soldiers of the 17th Infantry Battalion had an encounter with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Barangay Masi, Rizal, Cagayan on 24 April. 1 soldier died and 1 soldier was wounded.
A village chief was killed by unidentified gunmen in San Rafael, Bulacan on 24 April.
Two warring Moro families clashed at sea off Lantawan, Basilan on 24 April. There were three injuries.

Agreement: Tarcisio Barros, the leader of a private army, surrendered to the governor of Bukidnon at Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental on April 24. Barros and his private army were involved in a April 21 shootout.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: Three drug suspects were killed during a police raid in San Pablo City, Laguna on 25 April. One of them was formerly an anti-drug enforcement officer.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Calamba City, Laguna on 25 April.
Unidentified gunmen killed a village chair re-electionist in Kiamba, Sarangani on 26 April. Police are investigating whether the incident is politically motivated.
An unidentified drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Imus, Cavite on 26 April.
An unidentified drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Bacoor, Cavite on 26 April.
A former village chief and his wife were attacked by unidentified gunmen in Bulacan province, Central Luzon on 27 April. The village chief died, while his wife survived.

Public school teachers led by the Alliance for Concerned Teachers demonstrated in front of Malacanang Palace, Manila on April 27. They criticized the government for refusing to substantially increase wages of government employees.
The League of Filipino Students protested in front of the City Hall in Davao City, Davao del Sur on 27 April to protest the alleged torture of a Filipino national by the US government.
A village chief candidate and his father were killed by unidentified gunmen in Calbayog, Samar on 27 April. Branzuela may have been killed due to his plans to run for office.
On 27 April 2018, a drug suspect was abducted by unidentified assailants in Santa Maria (Bulacan, Central Luzon). He has been missing for over two years since.

assoc_actor_2: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)
notes: A peasant leader and chairperson of Guinpanaan Farmers Association-KMP was shot dead by four motorcycle-riding assailants believed to be state actors (assumed military) in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental on 28 April. A bystander was also wounded.
Defusal: Explosives experts (assume military) defused the improvised explosive device planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters in Koronadal, South Cotabato.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay Dacudao, Calinan District in Davao City on 29 April.

Soldiers of the 46th, 60th, and 71st Infantry Battallion had a series of encounters with New People's Army rebels at Camadi District in Asuncion, Davao del Norte on April 29. The rebels were attempting to flee. 1 soldier died, while 2 others were injured.
Two police officers and two civilians were kidnapped by suspected Abu Sayyaf rebels in Patikul, Sulu on 29 April.
Two soldiers of the Army's 33rd Infantry Battallion were ambushed by suspected members of BIFF in Barangay Tinumigues, Lambayong, Sultan Kudarat on 29 April. There was 1 injury and 1 fatality.

source: Philippine Star; Front Line Defenders; Rappler; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: A Catholic priest and an anti-mining advocate was killed by unidentified gunmen in Gattaran, Cagayan on 29 Apr 2018. Police suspect that his death had something to do with his anti-mining advocacy and that hired killers are behind the incident.
The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters set off a bomb at a Catholic cathedral in Koronadal, South Cotabato on 29 April. Two civilians were injured.
A security guard was killed by unidentified gunmen in Calamba City on 29 April.
A radio broadcaster was killed by unidentified armed men in Dumaguete, Negros Oriental on 30 April.
Drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Barangay Cotta in Lucena, Quezon on 30 April.
Two unarmed soldiers of the 88th Infantry Brigade were ambushed by the New People's Army in Quezon, Bukidnon on 30 April. 1 of the soldiers died, while the other 1 survived.

Soldiers had an encounter with New People's Army rebels at a military checkpoint in Barangay Sonlon, Ausuncion, Davao del Norte on 30 April. One NPA rebel was killed and 6 injured; 1 soldier was killed and 2 injured. 1 unidentified NPA leader was captured.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Special Action Force
notes: Two soldiers of the Army's 5th Special Forces Battallion were killed by suspected members of BIFF in Cotabato City town area, Maguindanao on 30 April.
Two drug suspects had a shootout with police in General Santos, South Cotabato on 30 April. A police officer was killed. The two suspects escaped but were later arrested.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Dalaguete, Cebu on 30 April.
